issue.title: Added JS tests for yii.captcha.js (#12840), fixes #13159

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes, it contains some bug fixes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #12840, #13159

body: it's very good to reassess the JS code with all the dust on it. Let's create tests first and then update the core code.

@dynasource This was blocking the entire test suite for captcha plugin because after each test `destroy` is called to simulate initialization from scratch. So I think fixing it along with writing tests is OK in this case. But I agree that for "cosmetic" fixes like removing linebreak it's better to open separate PRs.

issue.title: Allow repeated initialization in yii.captcha.js

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body: HTML: ```html ``` JS: ```js $('#captcha').yiiCaptcha({ refreshUrl: '/site/captcha?refresh=1', hashKey: 'yiiCaptcha/site/captcha' }); ``` On each repeated init according `init` method will run and as a result 1 more additional AJAX request will be executed when clicking on the image. Even the plugin is tiny, ideally it needs to check if it was already initialized with this element. - If it was initialized before with the same exact settings - we can warn the user with according message. - If it was initialized before but with different settings, we need to destroy it and reinitialize it with new settings. Comparing of the settings is not difficult here, but as an alternative we can always destroy and reinitialize. As I said in #13159, majority of the people will never get into this kind of trouble because they just add captcha on PHP side, it will automatically generate JS and they forget about it. But with writing tests and potential decoupling of JS I think it becomes more important. I think `yii.captcha.js` is not the only plugin with this problem, but firstly I noticed it there in #13160.

body: The issue should be closed, right?

@SilverFire Yes. But I started to write tests for `yii.gridView.js` and found that exactly the same issue exists there. Should we make it common for all framework's JS plugins? I think this will be better rather than creating similar issues for each plugin. If you are agree, I can modify the title and description, and remove accoring changelog line, then apply modified changelog line and close this issue only when it will be fixed everywhere.

body: @SilverFire It's quite different for `yii.gridView.js`, so I think it's better to have a separate issue with explanation and details for it. I'm closing this one as already solved.
